title: Cuisinart Pizzelle Press (WM-PZ2) Demo Video
description: Cuisinart engineering simplifies the art of baking the perfect pizzelle. The Cuisinart® Pizzelle Press makes two thin, crisp 4-inch cookies at once. Dual indicator lights provide easy operation and take the guesswork out of timing. Pizzelle can be baked at one of 5 browning levels. Nonstick plates let consumers remove warm pizzelle without breaking them, so they can be rolled for cannolis or cones. Plates wipe clean with a damp cloth, and the unit stands up for compact storage.

asset.title: Cuisinart Pizzelle Press (WM-PZ2) Demo Video
asset.description:
Learn more: http://www.cuisinart.com/products/waffle_makers/wm-pz2.html

Cuisinart engineering simplifies the art of baking the perfect pizzelle. The Cuisinart® Pizzelle Press makes two thin, crisp 4-inch cookies at once. Dual indicator lights provide easy operation and take the guesswork out of timing. Pizzelle can be baked at one of 5 browning levels. Nonstick plates let consumers remove warm pizzelle without breaking them, so they can be rolled for cannolis or cones. Plates wipe clean with a damp cloth, and the unit stands up for compact storage.

asset.author: Cuisinart

transcripts: Hi I'm Mary Rogers and this is the Cuisinart Pizzelle maker, a Pizzelle is an italian cookie and you need a special form to make it and we've done that by using this unit let me show you what it looks like inside you'll notice there are two separate forms and that's where the design comes from its four inches wide and you get two cookies at a time what you do is after you make the batter which you should check your instruction book for you use this little spoon and you put the batter right in the center of the cookie. Then you close this down and then the lid locks in place and that keeps the plates really tight so when the cookie dough is baking you get a beautiful finished cookie. right like here the other thing that's really nice is you can see it has a brushed stainless steel housing with black accents it also has a Browning control here all the way on one side is one on the other side is five you can do one is light five is darker you can experiment and find the shade that you prefer over here is you're ready to bake and ready to eat light it turns green when you're ready to put your dough in what will happen the light will go off and went after you put the dough in it look cook and go back on letting you know that it's time to remove your cookie and it's ready to eat. We also include a dowel with your Pizzelle maker and this will help you make other things other than just the flag cookie what you can do is when you remove the cookie from the maker after its done baking when it's still soft and pliable you roll it around the dowel and you let it cool a little bit then you remove the dowel and what happens is you have a forum for like a cannoli and you can stuff it with a cheese mixture for dessert the other thing you can do is roll these cookies into a cone shape and you can actually use it as an ice cream cone so go ahead and have a little fun with your Pizzelle maker.
